intro: Burmeistera fuscoapicata, commonly known as the black-tipped burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the genus Burmeistera in the family Campanulaceae, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are typically yellow with a distinctive black tip on the petals, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
